messageHandlers.code: window.bonus = 0;

1.title: Instructions
1.content:
Your task

This experiment has three parts.

It involves searching for things and estimating the difficulty of different search tasks.

In the last two parts of the experiment you will earn points. If your final point count is at the top 30% of our participants, you will receive a bonus of £1.

messageHandlers.code: window.demoRTs=[]

this.data.accuracy = window.accuracy;
this.data.RT = window.RT;

messageHandlers.title: Prepare stimulus

messageHandlers.code:
var feedback = document.getElementById("feedback").innerHTML
feedback = feedback.replace(/_estimate_/g,String((window.demoEstimate/1000).toPrecision(2)))
feedback = feedback.replace(/_num_points_/g, String(window.demoBonus.toPrecision(2)))
document.getElementById("feedback").innerHTML = feedback;

19.title: estimation_feedback
19.content:
For this first estimation, you estimated that it will take you _estimate_ seconds to find 1 T among 3 randomly positioned rotated L's.
If you will find the T in _estimate_ seconds or less in part 3 of the experiment, you will get _num_points_ points. Otherwise, you will get zero points. Your final number of points will determine whether you get a bonus or not.

In the next 12 trials you wil estimate how long it will take you to find one tilted orange bar among different distractors.

21.title: Instructions2a
21.content:
Part 2

Good, you finished the first part!

Now, you will estimate how long it will take you to find various targets when mixed with different numbers of various distractors.

22.title: Instructions3
22.content:
Part 3

You finished the second part!

In the third and last part of the experiment, you will perform three trials of each visual search task for which you gave a time estimate. Try to be as fast and accurate as possible, as your bonus depends on this! Just like in the first part, there's no time pressure on pressing the number key, but only on pressing the spacebar.

23.title: Instructions1a
23.content:
Part 1

In the first part, you will find a target hidden among distractors.

First, a gray cross will appear on the screen. Look at the cross. Then, the target and distractors will appear. When you spot the target, press spacebar as quickly as possible.

Upon pressing the spacebar, the target and distractors will be replaced by up to 5 numbers. To move to the next trial, type in the number that replaced the target.

25.content:
Thank you.

We will appreciate any thoughts or comments you have about the experiment. You can use the box below to share them with us. Thank you!
25.title: Form

27.title: Screen
27.content:
Thank you!

The experiment is now complete.

You can now close the window

35.title: Instructions2b
35.content:
In each trial, you will estimate how long it will take you to find a target when mixed with other distractors presented in a square. Only the identity and number of distractors are relevant here, not their specific locations.

Be as accurate as possible.

In the third part, you will perform these searching tasks, and receive points only if you find the target as fast as your estimate, or faster. You will get more points if your estimate was that you will find the target quickly, and less points if you estimated that finding the target will take you long.

To help you in your estimation, small black arrows will mark your search times from the first part of the experiment.

36.title: Instructions1b
36.content:
Be quick to press the spacebar. There's no time pressure on pressing the right number key.

Let's start!
